intro: Calycera herbacea, commonly known as the brittlecup, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its herbaceous, often sprawling growth habit and is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plant features small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to elliptic in shape, and often have a distinctive ribbed or veined structure. Calycera herbacea typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, stream banks, and woodland edges.
